description: PROPOSED PART SINGLE-STOREY AND PART DOUBLE-STOREY REAR EXTENSION. ALTERATION TO REAR LOFT DORMER AT NO 16 BIRKBECK ROAD TO MATCH THAT OF NO 18.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
   ii) The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict. 
   iii) The applicant engaged in pre-applicaiton advice in respect of this application. The concerns raised by officer raised have pre-app have not sufficiently been overcome to render the application acceptable. 
.

Reason : 1 - The proposed development would, by virtue of its scale, form and design, cause material harm to the character and appearance of the host dwelling and surrounding area, contrary to Merton Core Strategy Policy CS14 (2011) and Merton Sites and Policies Plan DMD2 and DMD3 (2014).

Reason : 2 - The proposed development would, by virtue of its scale, form and depth, cause material harm to the amenity of neighbouring occupiers, contrary to Merton Sites and Policies Plan DMD2 (2014).
